answers.answer: People with diabetes can develop many different foot problems. Even ordinary problems can get worse and lead to serious complications.Foot problems most often happen when there is nerve damage, also called neuropathy, which results in loss of feeling in your feet. Poor blood flow or changes in the shape of your feet or toes may also cause problems.It appears your doctor has no concern for your well being. Isn't there another doctor you can see such as one in the Palomar Medical Center?
I second Wave's opinion. Go find another doctor ASAP. Your leg & foot problem should not be ignored by any doctor.

question: I have Diabetes type 2For a long time now my legs and feet are sore all the time.the thing is that now my toes are always so cold that their num, they hurt a lotWhat can I do? I keep telling my DR. he keeps telling me that there's nothing to do.
title: Toes & legs
